Are you saying camera calibration? Because yeah there’s some different std devs for that.

Limelight: ChArUco Camera Calibration | Limelight Documentation

Photonvision: Calibrating Your Camera - PhotonVision Docs

Enough confusion here that it would be best for you to answer the question - Why do you ask?

Maybe a (simplistic) roadmap to the other posted answers will help you.

  1. Standard Deviations are input to the WPILib Pose Estimator as a measure of quality to weight how much to believe the various inputs. Generally there is no standard deviation per se for vision and just rather arbitrary numbers with relative magnitudes as the WPILib documentation suggests. Pose Estimators — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

  2. Standard Deviations are output as a result of the once per camera calibration process that can give you some measure of the quality of the estimated camera parameters. OpenCV: Camera Calibration and 3D Reconstruction

  3. I don’t know what AdvantageScope has to do with Standard Deviations.
